page.title: 15RECREATION 4
page.content: Perhaps the people least catered for socially are teenagers. There are no shops for young people and only an amusement arcade and discos to take up their spare time. Most are members of sports clubs. Balanced against this is the availability of temporary employment which means teenagers have plenty of money, much of which is saved - pupils spend ,on average, Â£3.44 per week. Being a tight-knit community it can be a bad thing if you don't fit in - therefore there is a great pressure to conform. And although when leaving school employment can be found in local trades, joiners, butchers etc. there is the local saying, "The clever ones leave the quickest."
